item.title: 日本将超预期削减超长期债券发行量
item.description: 在近几个月超长期债券收益率屡创新高引发市场担忧之后，日本计划今年削减超长期债券的发行量，削减幅度超过早些时候的报道。【原文：Japan is planning to cut the issuance of super-long bonds this year by more than earlier reported, after record highs in super-long yields in recent months stoked market concerns.】

item.title: 货币交易员在期权押注中放弃美元转投欧元
item.description: 鉴于不可预测的美国政策和全球贸易战所带来的风险，交易员们纷纷绕开美元，欧元在全球货币期权市场上扮演着越来越重要的角色。【原文：The euro is taking on a bigger role in the global currency options market as traders skirt around the dollar given the risks from unpredictable US policy and a global trade war.】

item.title: 奇货可居：王紫晨美国离职访谈（播客）
item.description: 王梓晨是《北京学》通讯的作者，该通讯将中国的重要讲话和文章翻译成英文，并为西方读者介绍其来龙去脉。在过去的一年里，他一直在普林斯顿大学攻读硕士学位，不过最近他已经回国，继续在中国的一家智库工作。由于中美关系日益紧张，对中国留学生的限制也越来越多，他在美国的这段经历显然是在一个非常有趣的时刻发生的。【原文：Zichen Wang is the writer of the Pekingnology newsletter, which translates important speeches and articles from China into English, and contextualizes them for Western readers. Over the past year, he’s been a master’s degree student at Princeton University, although he’s recently returned home to resume his career at a think tank in China. His stint in the US obviously came at a very interesting time, both due to the rising US-China tensions, and also the growing restrictions on Chinese students】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利质疑数字英镑对消费者的影响
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）对为消费者提供数字英镑的必要性表示怀疑，并对英国是否会推进其计划提出质疑。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey cast doubt on the need for a digital pound for consumers, calling into question whether the UK will push ahead with its plans.】

item.title: 印度顶级房地产经纪人的孟买复出项目将于七月推出
item.description: DLF Ltd. 计划下月开始预订孟买的一个高档住宅项目，这标志着这家印度顶级开发商时隔 13 年后重返金融之都，同时寻求新的增长市场。【原文：DLF Ltd. plans to start bookings in a premium residential project in Mumbai next month, marking the return of India’s top developer to the financial capital after thirteen years as it seeks newer growth markets.】

item.title: 港元跌至固定交易区间的弱势末端
item.description: 港元兑美元汇率跌至固定交易区间的弱势末端，因为低廉的融资成本鼓励投资者借入港元并买入美元。【原文：The Hong Kong dollar dropped to the weak end of its fixed trading range against the greenback, as cheap funding costs encouraged investors to borrow it and buy the US currency.】

item.title: 格陵兰颁发国防工业关键金属许可证
item.description: 在国防工业需求不断增长的情况下，格陵兰允许一家加拿大矿业公司勘探钼矿。【原文：Greenland has given permission to a Canadian mining company to explore for molybdenum, a metal critical to the production of steel, amid growing demand from the defense industry.】

item.title: 高盛、花旗认为欧洲经济优势将延续股市涨势
item.description: 华尔街策略师认为，贸易和地缘政治的危险只会减缓欧洲股市的涨势，而不会使其脱轨。【原文：The perils of trade and geopolitics will only slow the rally in European stocks rather than derail it, according to Wall Street strategists.】

item.title: 法国 6 月制造业信心指数意外下滑
item.description: 法国制造业的信心在 6 月份意外下降，为已经在努力追赶欧洲同行步伐的法国经济增添了警示信号。【原文：French manufacturing confidence fell unexpectedly in June, adding to warning signs for an economy already struggling to keep pace with European peers.】

item.title: Ares 据称将收购 Northstar 基金以促进亚洲私募股权投资增长
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，尽管印尼私募股权公司 Northstar Group 曾投资于失败的初创企业 eFishery，但 Ares Management Corp. 已接管了该公司之前管理的三支基金。【原文：Ares Management Corp. has taken over control of three funds previously managed by Indonesian private equity firm Northstar Group despite the latter’s investments in failed startup eFishery, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 丰田公司提起 3.61 亿美元的南非洪灾损失诉讼：英国电信
item.description: 据《商业日报》报道，丰田汽车公司已向南非法院提起诉讼，要求赔偿 65 亿兰特（3.61 亿美元），因为 2022 年的洪灾导致其德班附近的工厂停产。【原文：Toyota Motors Corp. has brought a lawsuit for 6.5 billion rand ($361 million) in a South African court for 2022 flood damages that shuttered its plant near Durban, Business Day reported.】

item.title: 英国零售销售额下降 2.7%，经济前景堪忧
item.description: 英国零售销售额出现了自 2023 年以来的最大跌幅，消费者支出急剧逆转，表明第二季度经济可能陷入困境。【原文：UK retail sales suffered the sharpest fall since 2023, in a sharp reversal of consumer spending that suggests the economy could be struggling in the second quarter.】

item.title: 英国预算赤字低于预期，为里夫斯打气
item.description: 本财年前两个月，英国政府借贷低于预期，这对英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）来说是一个适度的鼓舞，因为她面临着越来越多的质疑，即她能否在不进一步征税和支出的情况下保持预算限额。【原文：UK government borrowing came in below forecast in the first two months of the fiscal year, a modest boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves as she faces growing questions over whether she can keep to her budget limits without further tax and spending pain.】

美国对中国小包裹加征关税，挤压出口商的生存空间
item.description: 美国对来自中国的小包裹加征关税引发了上个月货运量的下滑，导致双边贸易大幅下降，并使申银万国集团有限公司（Shein Group Ltd.）等出口商陷入困境。【原文：US tariff hikes on small packages from China triggered a slump in shipments last month, contributing to a huge drop in bilateral trade and roiling exporters like Shein Group Ltd.】

item.description: 在周六举行的年度股东大会上，一家半导体材料生产商的总裁面临被投票罢免的风险，这表明股东的激进主义正在抬头。【原文：In a sign of rising shareholders’ activism, a president of a semiconductor material maker is at risk of getting voted out of office at the firm’s annual general meeting Saturday.】

item.title: 欧洲武器复兴：本土武器对抗美国强手
item.description: 随着各国政府开始史无前例地扩大国防开支，欧洲的军火制造商正在与美国竞争对手展开激烈竞争，以在该地区快速增长的军事市场中分得一杯羹。【原文：Europe’s arms manufacturers are duking it out with American rivals to win their slice of the region’s fast-growing military pie, as governments embark on an unprecedented expansion of defense spending.】

item.title: 西兰制药股价暴跌 46%，肥胖症新药岌岌可危
item.description: Zealand Pharma A/S 的股价跌至近 18 个月来的最低点，因为这家丹麦生物技术公司的实验性减肥药面临着日益激烈的竞争，而关键的试验结果还需要漫长的等待。【原文：Zealand Pharma A/S’s shares have slid to a near 18-month low, as the Danish biotech’s experimental weight-loss drug faces mounting competition and a long wait ahead for crucial trial results.】

item.title: 中国 5 月稀土永磁出口下滑，尤其是对美国的出口
item.description: 受与华盛顿的贸易战影响，5 月份中国稀土永磁出口进一步下滑，尤其是对美国的出口急剧下降。【原文：Chinese exports of rare earth magnets slumped further in May, with shipments to the US showing an especially steep drop due to the trade war with Washington.】

item.title: 伊朗危机加剧，中国创纪录的石油库存提供缓冲
item.description: 中国是伊朗原油的最大进口国，中国的炼油企业目前对中东原油供应中断的可能性并不担心，因为中国拥有创纪录的原油库存，可以提供暂时的缓冲。【原文：Oil refiners in China — the largest takers of Iranian crude — are unfazed for now about the possibility of interruptions to Middle Eastern supplies given the nation has a record stockpile that provides a temporary buffer.】

item.title: NTT 163 亿美元收购人工智能公司交易获支持
item.description: 日本电信电话公司（Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp.）表示，它已获得足够多的竞标来收购 NTT Data Group Corp.，这笔价值 2.37 万亿日元（约合 163 亿美元）的交易有望推动其人工智能雄心，并简化公司结构。【原文：Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it has secured enough bids to buy NTT Data Group Corp., with the deal worth ¥2.37 trillion ($16.3 billion) expected to boost its AI ambitions and simplify the corporate structure.】

item.title: 美国汽车协会（AAA）称，油价下跌将促使七夕节公路旅行人数创下新高
item.description: 在四年来最便宜汽油的助推下，预计将有创纪录数量的美国司机在下周末开始的七月四日假期上路。【原文：A record number of US drivers are expected to hit the road for the July Fourth holiday period starting next weekend, helped by the cheapest gasoline in four years.】

item.title: 伊朗劫持家庭安全摄像头在以色列境内进行间谍活动
item.description: 伊朗正在利用以色列的私人监控摄像头来收集有关其对手的实时情报，这暴露了该设备在其他全球冲突中经常出现的问题。【原文：Iran is tapping into private security cameras in Israel to gather real-time intelligence about its adversary, exposing a recurrent problem with the devices that has emerged in other global conflicts.】

item.title: 桑切斯反对 5%的目标，使北约的特朗普计划面临风险
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）面临的问题越来越多，有可能蔓延到下周的北约峰会，并可能给欧盟其他国家带来严重后果。【原文：The problems piling up for Primer Minister Pedro Sanchez in Spain are threatening to spill into next week’s NATO summit, with potentially drastic consequences for the rest of the European Union.】

item.title: 花旗集团称，如果霍尔木兹海峡关闭，石油价格可能飙升至 90 美元
item.description: 花旗集团称，如果霍尔木兹海峡关闭，布伦特原油可能跃升至每桶 90 美元左右。【原文：Brent crude could jump to around $90 a barrel if the Strait of Hormuz is closed, according to Citigroup Inc., which added that a prolonged halt to shipping through the crucial waterway would be unlikely.】

item.title: 新世界接近达成再融资协议，债券价格飙升
item.description: 新世界发展有限公司的美元债券有望创下本月最高水平，因为该公司即将完成一项关键的贷款再融资交易。【原文：New World Development Co.’s dollar bonds are poised to hit their highest levels this month as the company closes in on a crucial loan refinancing deal.】
